creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: Collector stamp [Alfred Hubert (?-1908), stamp (L.130)] in black ink, verso lower right
inscribed:
Inscribed in oval around crest, upper center: IE MAIN TIENDRAY

Inscribed in margin around frame: GUILELM. D.G. ... COMES NASSAUIÆ ... A.o CIC.LXXXI.


Signed in plate in small cartouche below frame, lower center: HGoltzius fecit.

Four lines in Latin in cartouche below frame, lower center: Impia vis fremat: ... patriae pia iura tueri. 

Four scenes in each corner, each with one line in Latin

texts.textentryhtml: Alfred Gabriel Hubert [1831-1908, Lugt 130]; sale of his collection, Paris, May 25-29, 1909, lot 288; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.
